quiz.question: Which suffragist said "Failure is impossible" during a women’s suffrage campaign?
Which composer and nationalist said "Music is the shorthand of emotion" historically attributed to a famous thinker?
Which English revolutionary declared "Give me liberty or give me death" in a lesser-known pamphlet aside from Patrick Henry?
Who said "Ask not what your country can do for you" in 1961?
Who proclaimed "The ends justify the means" is often associated with which political theorist?
Which ancient Chinese philosopher wrote "He who controls others may be powerful" in a military treatise?
Who declared "Peace for our time" in 1938 after meeting Hitler?
Who asserted "A people that values its privileges above its principles will soon lose both"?
Which 19th-century pope wrote "We can do nothing without men's approval" in diplomatic commentary?
Who said "Speak softly and carry a big stick" as a foreign policy motto?
Who declared "Paris is worth a mass" when converting for political reasons?
Which British admiral told subordinates "I have not yet begun to fight" in naval battle?
Who said "The die is cast" upon crossing the Rubicon River?
Which Egyptian leader declared "Peace for the region must come" during mid-20th-century diplomacy?
Who wrote "The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history"?
